descriptionHtml:
Isabelle Rolaine Fix

==================
Description:
==================

When you talk to Dagur to start the \'Drowned Sorrows\' quest, he tells you that \"Ranmir was involved with a pretty young woman named Isabelle Rolaine.\" But when you find her, you realize that Dagur needs glasses, because Isabelle is much older than Ranmir, much older than Dagur, perhaps even older than your grandmother. Maybe a 300-year old vampire might consider Isabelle a \"young woman.\" Did you miss something? No, Bethesda did. This fix changes Isabelle to a young woman, as described by Dagur.

I don\'t know why trivial things like this bother me, but they just do, so there.


==================
Details:
==================

I simply replaced Isabelle\'s \'Age50\' face complexion textures with something...younger. The BSA contains the exported facegen files.


==================
Installation:
==================

I use the Mod Organizer. I highly recommend it because unlike manual installation or traditional mod managers, it will not install files directly into your game data folder, so there is no chance of leaving behind orphan files when you uninstall mods.

Otherwise, to install manually, just extract the archive into the game \'.../data/\' folder. 


==================
Un-Installation:
==================

Uninstall using the same mod manager you installed it with. If uninstalling manually, delete \'Isabelle Rolaine Fix.esp\' and \'Isabelle Rolaine Fix.bsa\' from \'.../data/\'. That\'s it.

==================
Conflicts:
==================

If you are using Winterlove\'s \'Consistent Older People\' mod, you -must- load this mod -after- \'Consistent Older People.\'


==================
Changelog:
==================

03/04/2013 - Initial Release

==================
Contact Details:
==================

My username is Ripple on both the official Bethesday forums and the Nexus. You know the rest.


==================
Credits:
==================

Thanks to Bethesda for creating Skyrim.
Thanks to the Oblivion/Fallout 3/Fallout NV/Skyrim modding communities for advice and help throughout the years.


==================
Licensing/Legal:
==================

Do whatever you want with this mod, I don\'t care.
author: Ripple
